intro: Scabiosa austroafricana, commonly known as the Southern African scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid conditions. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits called schizocarps, which contain several seeds. Scabiosa austroafricana is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
